data.title: use $(MAKE) variable in main Makefile
data.body:
Using special $(MAKE) variable has some benefits over explicitly calling
'make'.
When using this variable, make knows automatically to pass some of its
arguments to lower-level invocations.
Among other features, this enables multi-threaded building from top-dir.

data.title: Holes in terrain with Age2HD media
data.body:
After the game loads fully (took a while)

The map is shown with some holes on terrain. I don't know if it's caused by a difference in age2HD media content or by other bug related with the open driver (radeonSI)

data.title: Added draft for a general-purpose map/campaign editor
data.body: As more and more people get interested in openage, it sounds reasonable to have some kind of editor that can mess around with the game's file formats. This could also be used to test some stuff like the nyan parser where (graphical) editing is much faster done than actually using everything with in-game mechanics.

data.title: Loading screen
data.body:
The asset loading may take some time, especially it's currently dumb and just loads everything instead of accessing on demand.

There should be some "progress bar", "spinner" or at least on-screen hint that assets are being loaded. Probably related to #70, a black screen is likely to be seen when waiting for the asset loading.

</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Sometimes the game hangs loading with a black screen
data.body:
The log reads this:

```
DBG0  inserting new chunk at (00,00)
DBG0  neighbor 0 not found.
DBG0  neighbor 1 not found.
DBG0  neighbor 2 not found.
DBG0  neighbor 3 not found.
DBG0  neighbor 4 not found.
DBG0  neighbor 5 not found.
DBG0  neighbor 6 not found.
DBG0  neighbor 7 not found. 
```

It usually happens to me on a cold boot. It fixes by itself, I don't know what's the cause. When it fixes for the first time, it keeps working afterwards.

I'm on Arch Linux x86_64, currently running GNOME3. 

00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation 2nd Generation Core Processor Family Integrated Graphics Controller (rev 09)

Draw version in lower left corner, take 2
data.body: Version drawing and FPS drawing now done in the same function, toggled by F3. Now including the ability to build the game!

data.body: Version drawing and FPS drawing now done in the same function, toggled by F3.

data.title: Basic version drawing
data.body:
- Lower left corner, toggled by F1. Uses essentially the same
  technique as the FPS counter, since I shamelessly stole that
  code. Closes #27.

data.title: Terrain generation
data.body:
`openage` needs random map generation.

For that we probably need two approaches:

* Random map scripts
  * Be creative and implement configurable map generation in Python
  * On top of that, we can implement a [RMS script](http://aok.heavengames.com/blacksmith/showfile.php?fileid=12178) parser that then is mapped to the Python API
* As extension, deterministic infinite terrain generation, comparable to Minecraft, for unlimited map sizes.

The important part is the configurable RMS generator.
* Input: some configuration
* Output:
  * Terrain grid (with heights and tile type)
  * List of entities with their positions (trees, animals, resources)

Additionally CMake will find Python on OS X now. Fixes #16

data.title: Screenshot refactor with numbering and timestamping
data.body: Closes #45

data.title: Version detection for original media files
data.body:
The convert script should detect the present version of the original game and provide the matching file actions. This allows us to support different patch levels as 1.0c and better AOE:HD support.

@zuntrax started implementing the ideas which need to be adapted to the new codebase.

data.title: Play destruction sounds
data.body: Dirty magic number for demo purposes :smile:

data.title: Building placement sound

milestone.title: v0.3.0
milestone.description:
Render diamond-shaped map (monoterrain).
Any number of buildings (of any kind, in grid).
Mouse and keyboard scrolling.
Proper media conversion with version detection.

data.body: The sound playback when planting buildings does not work. The selection of the creation sound happens [in the temporary game loading routines](https://github.com/SFTtech/openage/blob/1de94e49f72cd6c118cc279d88a229a2f091ba03/cpp/game_main.cpp#L185), which seems to fail to associate the correct sound ids.

data.title: Support for multi-layer buildings (village center)

milestone.title: v0.3.0
milestone.description:
Render diamond-shaped map (monoterrain).
Any number of buildings (of any kind, in grid).
Mouse and keyboard scrolling.
Proper media conversion with version detection.

data.body:
Buildings like the village center consist of multiple parts so that units can walk under roofs etc.

These layers have to be represented somehow, and rendered as one single building.
The draw layer priority is secondary and should be rather easy to implement afterwards.

data.title: Building foundation offset

milestone.title: v0.3.0
milestone.description:
Render diamond-shaped map (monoterrain).
Any number of buildings (of any kind, in grid).
Mouse and keyboard scrolling.
Proper media conversion with version detection.

data.body:
The hotspot of buildings sprites may be offset. The placement algorithm probably needs to be fixed, the calculation is done [in the terrain_object class](https://github.com/SFTtech/openage/blob/b7af79f1d5bfcc9869353a73577bfe68193a2a10/cpp/terrain_object.cpp#L185). This algorithm needs to be improved, the hotspot is not correctly aligned with the terrain grid.

Error example:
![openage](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/673543/4837563/24e240e4-5fd9-11e4-84f9-90e761477f1b.png)

data.title: preprocessor-free coordinate system
data.body:
The preprocessor hackery has to be replaced by the new `openage.codegen` python generation.

This should create the necessary headers and should end the pain of the current C preprocessing implementation.

The implementation is located in `libopenage/coord`.

data.title: Make media conversion work on file sensitive system
data.body: My AoE installation has directories like DATA where openage expects Data. This pull request should solve the general case.

data.title: SDL rendering without OpenGL
data.body: It would be great to have simple SDL rendering without OpenGL for old & troubled video chips, that has no hardware acceleration for 3D & OpenGL.

data.title: Existing OSS to read/write dat files.
data.body:
Hi,

I've had the same dream like this project and started coding back then.  Here's the link to genieutils, a library that is able to read .dat files (and partly other formats) 

https://github.com/Tapsa/genieutils

and also a lib to read the language.dll files:

https://github.com/apreiml/pcrio

data.title: Automatic asset refreshing with inotify
data.body: This introduces an AssetManager to load, own, and monitor textures. Eventually it could be used for other assets. Notably, it doesn't currently monitor docx files for subtextures.

data.title: Allow building bridges in-game
data.body:
Would be nice if you can add support to build a bridge in game mode. This is posible in map editor but not in game.

Thanks.

data.body:
We need a better logging system.

Filtering messages, verbosity levels, origin tracking, backtraces, ...

data.title: Static code analysis
data.body: In addition to test cases, we should have some kind of static code analysis integrated into the buildsystem.
